page.title: 07A LIFE-TIME IN IBSTOCK
page.content: One elderly resident of Ibstock is 82-year-old Mr Sid Ward, who lives next door to the junior school in Melbourne Road. Mr Ward worked as a butcher in the Ibstock branch of the Leicestershire Co-operative Society for 22 years. His father before him was a butcher and he recalls that as a boy he used to help his father kill sheep before walking a mile to school. Now, he says, the meat arrives at most butchers ready prepared, even pre-packed and frozen. The main change in Ibstock, says Mr Ward, is the increased traffic and housing. He remembers when there were thatched cottages on Chapel Street and extensive views over open fields where the Wilson and Jelson housing estates now stand.
